abstract: Pres Xi Jinping of China will have limited contact with Prince Charles during state visit to Britain, gesture possibly expressing judgment on China's human rights record; stance contrasts with Prime Min David Cameron's active cultivation of mutually beneficial economic relationship, which has divided country and its allies.
lead_paragraph: The prince’s refusal to attend the banquet for China’s leader is just one example of Britain’s attempt to balance commercial interests while not appearing to “kowtow” on rights.

headline.main: Before Palace Banquet for Xi Jinping, a Snub From Prince Charles
headline.print_headline: Britain Faces a Balancing Act as Xi Visits

snippet: The prince’s refusal to attend the banquet for China’s leader is just one example of Britain’s attempt to balance commercial interests while not appearing to “kowtow” on rights.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
